H0.text: Abnormal cell division is most often the result of cancer.

H1.text: Natural selection is the most common cause of cancer.

H2.text: Bacterial infection is most often the result of cancer.

H3.text: Biological adaptation is most often the result of cancer.

A4.text: The proportion of cells that are in active cell division (versus quiescent cells in G0 phase) in tumors is much higher than that in normal tissue.

A5.text: Many types of cancer are caused by mutations that allow the cells to speed through the various checkpoints or even skip them altogether, going from the S to M to S phase almost consecutively.
